sentences.en: ‘Good of you to arrive on time,’ George said, with heavy sarcasm (= very clear sarcasm ) .
sentences.cn: “你到得真准时啊。”乔治不加掩饰地挖苦道。

sentences.en: "What a pity," Graham said with a hint of sarcasm.
sentences.cn: “太遗憾了，”格雷厄姆略带挖苦地说道。

sentences.en: Chueh - min sensed the mild sarcasm, but he made no reply.
sentences.cn: 觉民知道觉慧在讥笑他, 便不作声了.
弗雷德对讽刺挖苦置之不理。

sentences.en: He could shatter airs and " respectability " with deadly sarcasm.
sentences.cn: 他能以无情的讽刺来粉碎派头和 “ 体面 ”.

sentences.en: He was totally flattened by her sarcasm.
sentences.cn: 她说的挖苦话使他无地自容.
她挖苦的语言刺伤了他的虚荣心.

sentences.en: His book commingles sarcasm and sadness.
sentences.cn: 他的作品混合了挖苦和悲伤.
他的讽刺伤害了她的感情.

sentences.en: His voice was dripping with sarcasm.
His voice was heavy with sarcasm.
sentences.cn: 他的话语里明显有讽刺意味。

sentences.en: She squelched them with biting sarcasm.
sentences.cn: 她用尖刻的挖苦话使人哑口无言.

sentences.en: She uttered the phrase with acid sarcasm.
sentences.cn: 她以辛辣的讽刺口吻说这个词.

sentences.en: She was given to using bitter sarcasm.
sentences.cn: 她惯于用尖酸刻薄语言挖苦人.

sentences.en: That does it! I've had enough of your sarcasm. I'm leaving.
sentences.cn: 够了! 你那些挖苦人的话我已经受不了啦. 我走了.

sentences.en: Your attempts at sarcasm are not very happy.
sentences.cn: 你的挖苦是很不成功的.

words.tran_cn: 嘲笑,嘲弄,讽刺,辱骂,侮辱

trans.tran_en: a way of speaking or writing that involves saying the opposite of what you really mean in order to make an unkind joke or to show that you are annoyed
